title: League of legends randomly crashes and stops audio from playing on the entire computer.
body: Sometimes, when I tab out and tab in again, it shows a black screen, freezes for a sec or two and then audio doesn't play until the computer is reset. Is there a way to prevent this from happening?

replies.body:
So I'm not the only one.

When a game ends, sometimes it kills all the sound on my computer. All the sound devices say they're working fine, but nothing makes a sound, even League, until I restart the computer (or log off and log back in, as I discovered the other day).
Have you found a way to fix it?

Outside of restarting or logging off? No, nor can I think of any cause as to why that happens, but since it doesn't happen with anything else I have, I can safely conclude it has something to do with the game client. It doesn't happen all the time, though; that makes it even more difficult to troubleshoot.
Are you using any background applications that are interacting with your audio? Also, if you change your windowed mode under **VIDEO** settings in-game to Borderless mode, does this still happen?

No I am not using any applications and yes it does still happen while windowed. It happened yesterday for the first time and has been happening to me even more frequently ever since. Did you guys send an update to our clients or something? Because it is really annoying to have to deal with it. You can't hear pings or any other audio and is very frustrating to play as.

Hmm, as a quick check, I'd ensure there aren't any third-party apps like gaming headset software or audio routing software causing this to happen by [completing a clean boot](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974#wq7). If you still encounter this issue, I'd say it's a good move to update your system drivers off of your manufacturer's website for your computer, or the motherboard's manufacturer (if the PC is a custom build).

Let me know if the issue persists.
It is ok, the problem is fixed. The HDMI seems to be the problem. It was properly placed and as result caused the screen to blink and turn off the audio. Thanks for the help though!
